attributes.action: Parliament should investigate Ofcom's meddling with Radio 2 peak time scheduling
attributes.additional_details: Richard Littlejohn provides his opinion at http://www.dailymail.co.uk/debate/article-4366494/RICHARD-LITTLEJOHN-Hey-Ofcom-leave-Radio-2-alone.html
attributes.background: Ofcom have proposed that during peak listening periods, Radio 2 be required to air at least three hours of news and current affairs per week. This new requirement is an unnecessary and very unwelcome interference with extremely popular Radio 2 programmes and formats

rejection.details:
It is not clear what you mean by investigate "Ofcom's meddling with Radio 2 peak time scheduling". 

We think that you might be talking about Ofcom's current consultation. You can find out more about that consultation and take part here:

https://www.ofcom.org.uk/consultations-and-statements/category-1/bbc-performance
